sense.name: the act of cleaning, usually with water
sense.examples: John gave his car a good wash in the driveway. These delicate fabrics should only have a gentle hand wash. The paint brushes were given a wash with mineral spirits.

sense.name: thin coating of liquid brushed on something
sense.examples: This watercolor was produced by layering successive washes of monochrome colors on to paper. The baker brushed the bread loaves with an egg wash before placing them in the oven.

sense.name: water-eroded channel or bed
sense.examples: We hiked across a wash along the floor of the desert. During rainstorms these washes can become dangerous with flash flooding. The coast road is closed while work crews fill in a wash caused by the recent storm.

sense.name: turbulent wave following the motion of a propeller
sense.examples: The wash from the motorboat slopped water into Mary's canoe. The prop wash from the helicopter blew John's hat off.

sense.name: load of laundry
sense.examples: Sally hung the wash out to dry on clotheslines. I did five loads of wash today.

sense.name: equilibrium with respect to benefit or advantage
sense.examples: Bob won $500 playing black jack but lost it all on the roulette wheel, so it was a wash. The plan's impact on jobs would be a wash, creating and destroying the same number of entry level positions.

sense.name: medicinal solution
sense.examples: The company is promoting a new type of mouth wash. These eye drops are basically a saline wash.

sense.name: water surging over something
sense.examples: At night we could hear the wash of waves against the shore of the lake. He gasped for air between the washes of waves breaking over him.

sense.name: fermentation of malt in preparation for distillation
sense.examples: The moonshiner checked his wash to see whether it was ready for the still.
